radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix is mildly dilated, measuring up to 8 mm with surrounding fat stranding and thickening of the lateral conal fascia. There is thickening of the cecal mucosa at the base of the appendix. The lung bases are clear. Focal calcifications in segment VI of the liver consistent with granulomas are noted. The liver enhances homogeneously. No free air or free fluid is present.
